Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • HumanPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class HumanPlayer
extends Player
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a human player, allowing a program user to select moves, as well as validating the positions selected are valid.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Checking a move is valid, meaning the start position has a valid piece, the end position can be moved to, and the shoot position can be shot at, according to the moving and shooting rules of Amazons.

      • isMoveValid

        private boolean isMoveValid​(Move move,
                            Board board)
        Checking a move is valid, meaning the start position has a valid piece, the end position can be moved to, and the shoot position can be shot at, according to the moving and shooting rules of Amazons.
        Parameters:
        move - Move to validate
        board - Board we are checking with
        Returns:
        true if move is valid, false otherwise.

      • validateCoordinate

        private boolean validateCoordinate​(java.lang.String coordinate,
                                   int columns,
                                   int rows)
        Checking if a string co-ordinate is valid, for the current board size.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - String representation of a co-ordinate
        columns - Number of columns on the board
        rows - Number of rows on the board
        Returns:
        true if co-ordinate is valid, false otherwise

        public Move getUserMove​(Board board)
        Asking for a move from the user, validating all the co-ordinates given, before returning the move.
        Parameters:
        board - The current state of the board
        Returns:
        The validated move
